main event: A resident of Wolfe City, Texas reported seeing an unidentified flying object (UFO) on September 29, 1960 between 2:00 AM and 6:00 AM.
interesting points: The object moved southerly from the horizon down to approximately 20 degrees, had the appearance of changing colors from white to orange, red, and green, and exhibited sudden, rapid movements like a satellite or guided missile.
The witness observed the object from his window and then drove out on the highway to observe it better, estimating it was about 5-6 miles away.
The object hovered momentarily, then darted from side to side, emitting brilliant flashes of white light that moved in an upward direction.
Two other witnesses in Wolfe City also observed the phenomenon and confirmed the object's motions and color changes.
The witness attempted to report the sighting to an agency in Dallas but was unable to reach them, so he reported it to the USAF UFO Project instead.
sighted object: an unidentified flying object that changed colors and exhibited rapid, erratic movements
witnesses: Emmit C. Mitchell and two other residents of Wolfe City
